iristk.util

Class BlockingByteQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • iristk.util.BlockingByteQueue

  • public class BlockingByteQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    Works like an ArrayBlockingQueue but with bytes. This means that one thread may write bytes to the queue while another thread reads them, blocking if not enough bytes have been written. The capacity is dynamically adjusted.

      • capacity

        public int capacity()

        public void write(byte[] bytes,
                  int pos,
                  int len)
        Writes len bytes from bytes, starting at position pos to the queue

      • write

        public void write(byte[] bytes)
        Writes bytes to the queue

      • endWrite

        public void endWrite()
        Ends the writing, which means that reading from the queue will no longer block. To restore the blocking, reset() muse be called.

      • read

        public int read(byte[] bytes,
                int pos,
                int len)
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Reads len bytes from the queue into bytes starting at position pos. Blocks if there are not enough bytes to read.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually read (which will always be the same as len unless the the endWrite() method has been called).
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • read

        public int read(java.io.OutputStream stream,
                int len)
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                java.io.IOException
        Reads len bytes from the queue and writes them to stream. Blocks if there are not enough bytes to read.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually read (which will always be the same as len unless the the endWrite() method has been called).
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException

      • skip

        public int skip(int len)
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Skips len bytes for reading. Blocks if there are not enough bytes to skip.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getWritePos

        public long getWritePos()
        Returns:
        the write position since start or reset

         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets and clears the queue

      • getInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
        Returns:
        An InputStream that reads from the queue

      • available

        public int available()
        Returns:
        the number of bytes that are available if the reading should not block

        public int getReadPos()
        Returns:
